# Test Parameterized Check Component

This runbook demonstrates the integration of `<Check>` with `<BoilerplateInputs>` for dynamic script parameterization.

## Example 1: Check with Inline BoilerplateInputs

This example shows a Check component with an inline BoilerplateInputs form.

<Check id="kms-check-inline" path="checks/kms-validation.sh">
  <BoilerplateInputs id="kms-inputs-inline">
    ```yaml
    variables:
      - name: KMSKeyId
        type: string
        description: "AWS KMS Key ID or ARN"
        required: true
        default: "arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:123456789012:key/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012"
      - name: AwsRegion
        type: enum
        options:
          - us-east-1
          - us-west-2
          - eu-west-1
          - ap-southeast-1
          - ap-northeast-1
          - ca-central-1
        description: "AWS Region"
        default: "us-east-1"
        required: true
    ```
  </BoilerplateInputs>
</Check>

## Example 2: Check with External BoilerplateInputs

First, define the BoilerplateInputs separately:

<BoilerplateInputs id="external-kms-inputs">
  ```yaml
  variables:
    - name: KMS_KEY_ID
      type: string
      description: "AWS KMS Key ID or ARN"
      required: true
      default: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:987654321098:key/abcdef01-2345-6789-abcd-ef0123456789"
    - name: REGION
      type: string
      description: "AWS Region"
      default: "us-west-2"
      required: true
  ```
</BoilerplateInputs>

Then reference it in the Check:

<Check 
  id="kms-check-external" 
  path="checks/kms-validation.sh"
  boilerplateInputsId="external-kms-inputs"
/>

## Example 3: Check with No Variables (Normal Script)

This check uses a non-templated script (for comparison):

<Check 
  id="simple-check" 
  path="checks/simple.sh"
  successMessage="Simple check passed!"
/>

## Notes

- Example 1 shows the inline pattern (recommended for single-use forms)
- Example 2 shows the external reference pattern (useful when multiple checks share the same variables)
- Example 3 shows backwards compatibility with non-parameterized scripts
